newsitem.title: SPAIN: Madrid stocks end slightly higher, BBV shines.
newsitem.headline: Madrid stocks end slightly higher, BBV shines.

text.p: Madrid stocks ended marginally higher on Wednesday, sapped of energy in late trade by a weak performance on Wall Street after a session of consolidation, traders said.
The general index rose 0.22 points, 0.05 percent, to 487.29 and the Ibex-35 added 2.18 points, 0.04 percent, to 5,588.03.
BBV shares stormed higher after analysts revised up first quarter results forecasts. BBV added 170 pesetas to 8,910.

A Reuters poll today found that analysts were on average expecting a 24.2 percent rise in BBV's first quarter attributable profit to 24.61 billion pesetas versus 19.81 this time last year. BBV is due to publish results on Thursday.
Traders said stocks had been consolidating after Tuesday's strong gains, with domestic investors taking profits.
Bankinter slipped 190 pesetas to 19,600 ahead of its results. After the close, the bank said its first quarter net profit rose to 5.12 billion pesetas from 4.73 billion.
Telefonica rose 10 pesetas to 3,515 while Repsol slipped 10 pesetas to 6,180.
